content: colorwork headband + beanie a fair isle knit to keep your head toasty and colorful colorwork headband hello this pattern was written for our colorwork knitting class this pattern is worked in the round using the fair isle/stranded colorwork technique materials yarn choice this pattern is written for sport weight yarn also known as 5 ply in australia and fine weight #2 in the us/canada we have used outlaw sport and cascade 220 sport superwash in our ​ samples ​ you will require 1x50gm ball of main colour mc and 1 x 50gm ball of contrast colour cc needles this project requires circular needles and is knit in the round 40 cm 3 5mm needle or size to obtain gauge is required other notions stitch markers tapestry/darning needle for finishing and weaving in ends ©beccatknits 2015 all rights reserved pattern is for personal use only 2 colorwork headband instructions cast on cast on 126 stitches with your prefered method we used long tail cast on in main colour knit 6 row in 1x1 rib work one row in stockinette colorwork join 2nd colour follow the chart repeating the pattern 9 times you can add a stitch marker between each repeat if you like finishing off work 1 row in mc work 6 row in 1x1 rib cast off in pattern weave in ends and block ©beccatknits 2015 all rights reserved pattern is for personal use only 3 colorwork headband colorwork beanie option if you would prefer a beanie to a headband instead of working the final 6 row of rib work as follows please note that a greater amount of mc yarn will be required but a 50g ball will be plenty you will also require 7 stitch markers work mc in stockinette until the piece is 14cm long if you want a slouchier beanie you can knit this section a few centimetres longer decrease for crown we will now be decreasing the stitch count on alternating row to create the crown of the beanie rnd1 *knit 16 k2tog pm repeat from * around 7 stitches decreased round 2 and every even round knit round 3 *knit until 4st to marker
